com.codecool.reviewservice.controller

Class ReviewController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codecool.reviewservice.controller.ReviewController

  • public class ReviewController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is for controlling everything related to product reviews.

    Kriszta

    • Method Detail

      • newReview

        public static java.lang.String newReview(spark.Request request,
                                         spark.Response response)
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                         InvalidClient
        The "/review/:APIKey/:productName/:comment/:ratings" route triggers newReview() which handles new reviews submitted by users of the web shops. First it runs a validation whether the API key of the shop is valid by calling the validateClient() method. If the API key is valid it creates a new Review object, adds it to the database and also passes it to a method from the Email class, called ReviewForModerationEmail(), which sends an email to the client. If the API key is invalid the method throws an InvalidClient exception.
        Parameters:
        request - A Spark request object
        response - A Spark response object
        Returns:
        null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.net.URISyntaxException
        InvalidClient
        See Also:
        IOException, URISyntaxException, InvalidClient, Email, Review

      • changeStatus

        public static java.lang.String changeStatus(spark.Request request,
                                            spark.Response response)
                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                            java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                            InvalidClient
        The changeStatus() method is responsible for switching the status of the reviews in the database, it is triggered by the "/changeStatus/:APIKey/:reviewKey/:status" route in the Server. By default every review is marked as PENDING and they can be set APPROVED or DENIED by the links provided in the emails sent to the clients. First the method runs a validation whether the API key is valid by calling the validateClient() method. If the API key is valid it sets the status of the review and redirects the user to the "/newstatus" route. If the API key is invalid the method throws an InvalidClient exception.
        Parameters:
        request - A Spark request object
        response - A Spark response object
        Returns:
        null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.net.URISyntaxException
        InvalidClient
        See Also:
        IOException, URISyntaxException, InvalidClient

      • getAllReviewFromClient

        public static java.lang.String getAllReviewFromClient(spark.Request request,
                                                      spark.Response response)
                                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                                      java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                                      InvalidClient
        This method is used for returning all approved reviews submitted on the client's web page as a JSON string. It is called through the "/reviewFromClient/:APIKey" route. Throws an InvalidClient exception if the API Key provided by the client is invalid.
        Parameters:
        request - A Spark request object
        response - A Spark response object
        Returns:
        String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.net.URISyntaxException
        InvalidClient
        See Also:
        IOException, URISyntaxException, InvalidClient, Review

      • getAllReviewOfProduct

        public static java.lang.String getAllReviewOfProduct(spark.Request request,
                                                     spark.Response response)
                                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                                     java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                                     InvalidClient
        This method is used for returning all approved reviews of a specific product from the database as a JSON string. It is called through the "/allReviewOfProduct/:APIKey/:ProductName" route. Throws an InvalidClient exception if the API Key provided by the client is invalid.
        Parameters:
        request - A Spark request object
        response - A Spark response object
        Returns:
        String Returns all approved Review objects of a specific product as a JSON string.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.net.URISyntaxException
        InvalidClient
        See Also:
        IOException, URISyntaxException, InvalidClient

      • validateClient

        private static boolean validateClient(java.lang.String APIKey)
        This method is used for validating the clients by their API Key. If the API key is not in the database the method returns false, if it is in the database, the method returns true.
        Parameters:
        APIKey - an unique hash belongs to every Client record in the database, this is the APIKey
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • getClientID

        private static int getClientID(java.lang.String APIKey)
        This method is used for getting a specific client's ID by their API Key.
        Parameters:
        APIKey - an unique hash belongs to every Client record in the database, this is the APIKey
        Returns:
        int Returns the ID of a client.

      • jsonify

        private static java.lang.String jsonify(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> reviews)
        This method is used for converting an ArrayList (which contains Review objects as strings) into JSON.
        Parameters:
        reviews - Review objects as strings in an ArrayList
        Returns:
        a JSON string of review objects.
